item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Heinrich Boll
item.description: "An artist is like a woman who can do nothing but love, and who succumbs to every stray male jackass." -- Heinrich Boll

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "One minute was enough, Tyler said, "A person had to work hard for it, but a minute of perfection was worth the effort. A moment was the most you could ever expect from perfection." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by anais nin
item.description: "They courted the face on the screen, the face of translucence, the face of wax on which men found it possible to imprint the image of their fantasy." -- anais nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by anais nin
item.description: "Coming near him like a ballet dancer she took a leap towards him, and he, frightened by her vehemence, and fearing that she would crash against him, instinctively became absolutely rigid, and she felt herself embracing a statue." -- anais nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by anais nin
item.description: "The obstacle became his alibi for weakness." -- anais nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by anais nin
item.description: "The man who was once starved may revenge himself upon the world not by stealing just once, or by stealing only what he needs, but by taking from the world an endless toll in payment of something irreplaceable, which is the lost faith." -- anais nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Russell Brand
item.description: "I hope it is not necessary for me to stress the platonic nature of our relationship- not platonic in the purest sense, there was no philosophical discourse, but we certainly didn't fuck, which is usually what people mean by platonic; which I bet would really piss Plato off, that for all his thinking and chatting his name has become an adjective for describing sexless trysts." -- Russell Brand

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Russell Brand
item.description: "Be led by your talent, not by your self-loathing; those other things you just have to manage." -- Russell Brand

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by azar nafisi
item.description: "She was one of those people who are irrevocably, incurably honest and therefore both inflexible and vulnerable at the same time." -- azar nafisi

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Jessica Valenti
item.description: "The desirable virgin is sexy but not sexual. She's young, white, and skinny. She's a cheerleader, a babysitter; she's accessible and eager to please (remember those ethics of passivity!). She's never a woman of color. SHe's never a low-income girl or a fat girl. She's never disabled. "Virgin" is a designation for those who meet a certain standard of what women, especially young women, are supposed to look like. As for how these young women are supposed to act? A blank slate is best." -- Jessica Valenti

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Jessica Valenti
item.description: "For women especially, virginity has become the easy answer- the morality quick fix. You can be vapid, stupid, and unethical, but so long as you've never had sex, you're a "good" (i.e. "moral) girl and therefore worthy of praise." -- Jessica Valenti

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "THE EDGE, there is no honest way to explain it because the only people who really know where it is are the ones who have gone over." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description:
"All my life, my heart has sought a thing I cannot name.
Remembered line from a long- forgotten poem" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Sex without love is as hollow and ridiculous as love without sex." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I feel the same way about disco as I do about herpes." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "He understands my pity for his ridiculous, humiliating physical necessity. " -- Anais Nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I hate men who are afraid of women's strength." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by anais nin
item.description: "How well I know with what burning intensity you live. You have experienced many lives already, including several you have shared with me- full rich lives from birth to death, and you just have to have these rest periods in between." -- anais nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "I often see how you sob over what you destroy, how you want to stop and just worship; and you do stop, and then a moment later you are at it again with a knife, like a surgeon. " -- Anais Nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I am moved by fancies that are curled, around these images and cling, the notion of some infinitely gentle, infinitely suffering thing." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "When you wept it was just over yourself and not because of the marvelous impossibility of reaching her through the difference that separates you." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Soon you give up, don't look for her anymore, either in the town or at night or in the daytime. Even so you have managed to live that love in the only way possible for you. Losing it before it happened." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Rule number one: Don't fuck with librarians." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Actually I didn't shoot a man in Reno just to watch him die, but he could tell I was extremely cross." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I have been a writer since 1949. I am self-taught. I have no theories about writing that might help others. When I write, I simply become what I seemingly must become. I am six feet two and weigh nearly two hundred pounds and am badly coordinated, except when I swim. All that borrowed meat does the writing. In the water I am beautiful. " -- Kurt Vonnegut
